ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC CDASH Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification Terminology

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Check the appropriate box to indicate if the subject has ever used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, currently consumes tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, or formerly used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SUOCCUR; SUSTRTPT; SUSTRF; SUENRTPT; SUENRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate SUOCCUR and relative timing variables.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: The three options, NEVER, CURRENT and FORMER are sponsor-defined in relation to the protocol. If the sponsor has specific definitions, these definitions are detailed in the instructions to the site. As this type of response does not correspond exactly to an SDTM variable, CDASH recommends using the CDASHIG variable SUNCF. Sponsor must decide how to populate the appropriate relative timing variables when the SDTM-based datasets are created. For example, If SUNCF = "Never", the value of SUOCCUR will be "N" and all relative timing variables will be null. If the sponsor chooses to populate the relative start references (SUSTRTPT, SUSTRF) the value will be "BEFORE" when SUNCF= "CURRENT" and "FORMER". If the sponsor also chooses to use relative end references (SUENRF, SUENRTPT) , the SUENRTPT value will be "ONGOING" when SUNCF="CURRENT" while the value of SUENRF will be "DURING/AFTER". Note: When using SUSTRTPT and/or SUENRTPT, these must refer to a "time point anchor" such as SCREENING in SUSTTPT/SUENTPT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant ever used marijuana

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant ever used tobacco?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant every used alcohol?
